# UnitConverter

**Class**

An abstract class that provides a description of how to convert a unit to and from the base unit of its dimension.

## Declaration

```swift
class UnitConverter
```

## Overview

For units that can be converted by a scale factor or linear equation, use the concrete subclass [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitConverterLinear].

### Subclassing Notes

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitConverter] is an abstract class that is intended for subclassing. You can implement your own subclass of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitConverter] to convert between units according to any desired mapping function. For example, units may be converted using a logarithmic, exponential, or quantile scale.

#### Methods to Override

All subclasses must fully implement the following methods:

- [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitConverter/baseUnitValue(fromValue:)]
- [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitConverter/value(fromBaseUnitValue:)]

#### Alternatives to Subclassing

As stated above, most physical units can be converted using a linear equation with [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitConverterLinear]. You should only create a custom subclass of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitConverter] for units that cannot be converted in this way.

## Converting Between Units

- **baseUnitValue(fromValue:)**: For a given unit, returns the specified value of that unit in terms of the base unit of its dimension.
- **value(fromBaseUnitValue:)**: For a given unit, returns the specified value of the base unit in terms of that unit.

## Conversion

- **UnitConverterLinear**: A description of how to convert between units using a linear equation.

- NSObject

- UnitConverterLinear
